page.title: 01General description-Whitton
page.content: The land is used for sheep and cattle farming and some forestry.There is flat good land in the valley of the Lugg (about 0.5km wide) and higher land, up to 400m, occupies two thirds of the block.'B' grade roads follow the southern and eastern edges with scattered farms and cottages along them. The hamlet of Whitton,with church,rectory and school is in the south-east corner on a crossroads. There is another church 2km west of Whitton at Pilleth where there is a big farm called Pilleth Court. The hills are rounded and grass covered being used for grazing while the lower land is used for grazing and mowing. There is some fishing in the river which is about 5m wide and 1m deep maximum. The area has not changed greatly for very many years.
